> @nlu90 I will start the 2.7.0 release process soon. Do you have time to add the documentation for #8432?

@codelipenghui Please add this task to me, I will process this task.

> What is the value returns before?

@sijie 
For Java 8u272, Arrays.asList(sslEngine.getSupportedProtocols()).toString() returns `[TLSv1.3, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.1, TLSv1, SSLv3, SSLv2Hello]`.
For Java 8u232, it's `[SSLv2Hello, SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2]`.

[The `protocols` field in `KeyStoreSSLContext` was unused before](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/5bbd44784a9e4bc58ee5025025d748b52b21825a/pulsar-common/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/common/util/keystoretls/KeyStoreSSLContext.java#L79) and it's an old bug that the field was never used to configure the enabled TLS protocols for the SSLEngine.

TLS `protocols` are properly passed in `NettyServerSslContextBuilder` class, so this has been a bug in the code that uses `KeyStoreSSLContext`.

btw. The KeyStoreSSLContext class is also used for the web server. In those cases, [the protocols aren't configured and there's also a comment about it in the code](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/5bbd44784a9e4bc58ee5025025d748b52b21825a/pulsar-common/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/common/util/keystoretls/KeyStoreSSLContext.java#L247). 
However there's a default value in `KeyStoreSSLContext` which will get used if null is passed to protocols. 
It's defined at https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/5bbd44784a9e4bc58ee5025025d748b52b21825a/pulsar-common/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/common/util/keystoretls/KeyStoreSSLContext.java#L52 .
Previously this default value has been ignored since it was never set to the SSLEngine. With this PR, it will get set.

> Is there any way to add a test case?
> This is security related code
> We should prevent regressions

Yes. It would be possible to create a negative test case where the client and server are configured to use different TLS protocols. In that case, the TLS handshake shouldn't succeed and the connection shouldn't get established. That would catch the bug that was in the code. In addition, there could be a few tests that check that connections can be established when the server contains at least one of the protocols that is enabled on the client.

Thanks for merging.

It will be useful if arm64 jobs are added to Travis-CI. If you are interested, I can help by raising another PR for adding arm64 jobs in Travis-CI.
@codelipenghui #8555 is to add rest-api but this PR actually fix dedup topic policy logic which doesn't support v1-topic name with `cluster-name` in it.

@merlimat @codelipenghui I am trying to fix this patch now.
btw **it is not a blocker for a release**.

We are also supporting ZooKeeper server in pulsar distribution, and AFAIK adapting the server side can be painful the way we are launching it.
 
Stay tuned

closing in favour of #8590 

btw @codelipenghui we cannot make this upgrade, a release on BK is needed, see #8590

I will try to implement this design.
@sijie was there a code fix because I can't find the related pull request or was @merlimat answer the right resolution?

Our performance measurements were very dependent on the system and were also somewhat small scale (only on a single machine) but they showed a clear advantage when many/most messages are filtered out.

End to end encryption would encrypt message properties so can’t be filtered as you might expect.

The filtered messages are acknowledged by the remote consumer in the normal way – within each filtered batch. This will need careful review by the experts but hopefully it’s done correctly but we’ve not tested failure cases (lossy network etc).

The ConsumerFilter can be dynamically loaded if that was what you are suggesting the NarClassLoader for but possibly it’s more like the AuthenticationProviders which are just class loaded from the class path? There’s only a single filter per broker so it’s more like an implementation that you can swap out rather than a user defined extension.

Cheers,
Andre

From: Sijie Guo <notifications@github.com>
Sent: 16 November 2020 17:57
To: apache/pulsar <pulsar@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Kramer, Andre <Andre.Kramer@softwareag.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [apache/pulsar] Consumer filtering (#8544)


@sijie requested changes on this pull request.

A couple of major comments:

  1.  what is the performance & GC implication here? I think the community would like to see benchmark results and performance numbers around that. So it would be good to show all the benchmark results and your test methodology along with this pull request.
  2.  how are you going to handle topics with end-to-end encryption enabled?
  3.  how do you handle acknowledgment?

Regarding the code itself.

  1.  Please use NAR class loader to load the class. See how we implemented the Offloader interface.

—

Do you have any idea for fixing this issue? Looks related to the netty related dependency upgrade.

Seems only affect the macos, I tried on ubuntu, it works. And after revert the version of netty-tc-native to 2.0.30.Final/2.0.31.Final also works well on macos. but 2.0.32.Final/2.0.33.Final/2.0.34.Final/2.0.35.Final can't works on macos.

Some developer notes / the producer is handled here -> https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-websocket/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/websocket/WebSocketProducerServlet.java

A first good step would be to still have different url for producer/consumer/reader, but be able to still use the same websocket connection for publishing to different topics.

@jiazhai  In my case though, I tried setting useTls, but it didn't solve the problem. So, maybe it's a separate issue.

@wolfstudy the change looks good. But I think we introduced a feature to support end-to-end encryption in Pulsar Function in #8432. I think we need to include this support for python functions as well. In this change, there is code generated for crypto reader. Can you create an issue to follow up to add this support?

> @wolfstudy the change looks good. But I think we introduced a feature to support end-to-end encryption in Pulsar Function in #8432. I think we need to include this support for python functions as well. In this change, there is code generated for crypto reader. Can you create an issue to follow up to add this support?

Sure, will process it.

I just saw that. Sorry for the miss. I wonder why it wasn't catched by CI...

@cbornet Don't mention it. I think the problem is some change related to the check style logic is merged during #6720 is running the CI tests. SO the CI tests passed but after it merged into the master branch, the master branch broken.

Our test found that this situation is random. Lookup timeouts are rare when there are not many consumers, and there is a high probability when there are many consumers. The situation we tested is 30 topic partitions, continuous When multiple programs are started, the probability of the later startup program reporting lookup timeout is significantly higher than that of the previous startup, causing the consumer program to hang

> @wolfstudy @rdhabalia let's create a fix on branch-2.6 and create a 2.6.3 release.
